title: Part. motion, given v(t) and s(0). part - b

content.description: A particle moves along a straight line. For 0 ≤ t ≤5 , the velocity of the particle is given by v(t)=-2+(t2+3t)6/5-t3, and the position of the particle is given by s(t). It is known that s(0)=10.
content.question: Write an expression involving an integral that gives the position s(t). Use this expression to find the position of the particle at time t=5.

frqParts.text: Write an expression involving an integral that gives the position s(t). Use this expression to find the position of the particle at time t=5.

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
